intro: Pavetta harborii, commonly known as the Florida pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in swampy areas and along stream banks. The leaves are typically oval-shaped with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance.
